description:
On the last day of the school year, 14-year-old Ichika Tachibana comes across an old, busted mirror in an unused campus building. When Manatsu, a mysterious girl from inside the mirror, steps out and offers her friendship for the summer, she also offers Ichika magical powers. Now, Manatsu must help Ichika unlock the powers of the 12 Djinn in order to complete her magic training... but perhaps this is something that will prove too difficult a task. Some offers may appear to be too good to be true and this one just may turn out to do more harm than good.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

title.native: うた∽かた - 初冬の双夏

node.description:
__[Website](http://goto.cute.or.jp)__

Gotou began his career as an animator at Atorie. After the closing of Atorie, he worked for other studios such as Project Team Muu and Fenx before going freelancer. He serves as character designer, animation director and animator on countless anime series and contributes to a monthly comic strip to Newtype magazine.

He has been an animator since he graduated from high school at 18. Unlike most other animators Gotou had never gone to an art school. He became interested in animation after seeing an advertisement in an animation magazine saying that animators were needed. Without having any connections within the industry he went on and joined Atelier Giga and studied there for a year under [Akihiko Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/103299/) before marking his debut as animator on [Mister Ajikko](https://anilist.co/anime/3437/).

In 1988 Studio Atelier declared bancrupcy and he went to Project Team Muu, which later became Phoenix Entertainment. His first work there was as animator on Anime Sanjushi. When working on the Yuusha Saga, he met Ishida Atsuko on Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn, who influenced Gotou in his character design, particularly the design of the eyes. Together with the experience from training under Yamashita Akihiko this influence resulted in Gotou's so called "gocky picture" later.

He made his debut as character designer on Choujin Densetsu Urotsukidouji 4 and his debut as series director on Kiddy Grade.

Married to [Megumi Kadonosono](https://anilist.co/staff/100963/).

(Source: Anidb)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芝美奈子)

Noted for her character designs on [Black Butler](https://anilist.co/anime/4898/), [Noir](https://anilist.co/anime/272/), [Tegami Bachi](https://anilist.co/anime/6444/) among many others.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/門之園恵美)

Married to fellow animator [Keiji Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/97307/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/きむらひでふみ)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mill_sister)** | **[Website (blog)](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/gooussy)**

Kiyoko Sayama is a Japanese director, episode director, animation director and storyboard artist.

Married to [Tetsuya Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/101548/Tetsuya-Kumagai).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

name.native: サヴィッジ・ジーニアス

node.description: savage genius is a Japanese band signed to Victor Entertainment. The duo Aa (vocals and lyricist) and Takumi (composer/arranger, producer) started as a songwriting group in the live music scene in Kobe. They debuted in the 2001 AXIA Artist Audition, and signed with Warner Music Japan, cutting two singles.  On November 30, 2007, it was announced that one of the group's members, Takumi, had retired.  (Source: Wikipedia)
Affiliated with [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/) since 2004.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1134744619810344960)

Originating from Dragon Production.
The representative director of Ryuubidou.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akichu5jp)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/azukosotokam)

Genichirou Abe is one of studio SHAFT's best and most respected animators being involved on nearly every major SHAFT production and even being included among the episode 15 [Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/Gurren-Lagann) all-star staff.

Abe's animation is characteristically layered and dense, and the way he draws hair, skin, and clothing with ruffles warrants comparison to [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/Hironori-Tanaka), who collaborated on Bakemonogatari. Many of his cuts have the Ohira wobble. Abe has said he enjoys doing background animation and integrates it into many of his scenes.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shoko_taiyaki)

Website Satou Tenshou is a Japanese animator, formerly belonging to Studio Wanpack, now a member of White Fox. His favourite anime are Sennen Joyuu, Kidou Senshi Gundam: Gyakushuu no Char, and Onegai Teacher. His nickname is MacGuyver. Having only served as an animator since Gad Guard he has shown to be proficient at displaying flowing stuff and its linework as well as excelling at storyboarding and portraying a good sense of camera action.

Hajime Ueda is a Japanese manga artist who created a two-volume adaptation of the Japanese animated OVA series FLCL, and the original manga Q·Ko-chan: The Earth Invader Girl. He started his career as a doujinshi artist, gaining a reputation for his quirky and unique style of art. He also does some costume design and sculpting. Ueda is also an artist known for his works with studio Shaft, particularly the Monogatari series in which he's acted as an opening and ending animator for various installments of the franchise.
Affiliated with [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miztama1016)__

Currently freelance. Watanabe started his career as an animator at Tsuchida Production, which he left in July 1986 after the studio's bankruptcy. He then joined Studio Gallop, where he was responsible for the character designs and chief animation direction for the studio's mahou shoujo titles such as [Hime-chan no Ribbon](https://anilist.co/anime/2037/), which was his debut as a character designer, [Akazukin Chacha](https://anilist.co/anime/103/) and [Nurse Angel Ririka SOS](https://anilist.co/anime/616/) as well as the hit TV anime series [Kodomo no Omocha](https://anilist.co/anime/1486/).

Frequent collaborator with [Akitarou Daichi](https://anilist.co/staff/100640/).

[Blog](http://kaishaku0.blog62.fc2.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kai_Seven_)

Kaishaku consists of artists Hitoshi Ota and Terumasa Shichinohe. The name comes from Kaishakunin (介錯人), an appointed second person whose duty is to decapitate one who commits seppuku (ritual suicide by disembowelment).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/きむらひでふみ)
